Benchmark: Name and describe key Jewish holidays and simple associated practices.
Identify basic concepts such as mitzvah, tzedakah, Shabbat, and explain in their own words what they mean.
Explain the basic meaning and key practices of major holidays and life‑cycle events and connect them to simple textual sources.
Identify and describe a core Jewish belief or value (e.g., belief in one God, importance of Torah, responsibility to others) and how it shows up in practice.
Describe multiple perspectives within Jewish tradition on selected beliefs or practices (e.g., Shabbat observance, tzedakah priorities).
Explain how Jewish law and values guide decision‑making in selected real‑life scenarios (e.g., ethical dilemmas, interpersonal conflicts).
Analyze how core Jewish beliefs (e.g., covenant, peoplehood, divine command, free will) are articulated in different periods and streams of Jewish thought.
Evaluate contemporary Jewish practices or communal norms in light of classical sources and values.
